detailsOfAchievement: ACTIVITIES â€¢ Directorate of Social Welfare, Assam has sanctioned Anganwadi Workers Training Centre to the Kendra to conduct training programmes to the workers. The course was started from 3rd December 2003. The Kendra has completed 52 batches of job training course for Anganwadi workers, 21 Orientation Training for Helpers and 34 of Refresher course to Workers and 6 refresher training to Helpers upto 2016. â€¢ Counseling cell for the distressed women has been offering service to the women. â€¢ Motherâ€™s meeting was held after every three months to discuss the importance of children education, nutritious food and health education. â€¢ Members of the Kendra joined in pulse-polio programmes twice in the year. â€¢ To generate awareness on health related issues the organization has been organizing health programmes from 2004 onwards by a group of doctors. â€¢ Members of the Kendra organised an awareness programme for keeping Kharghuli clean along with other organisation of the locality. â€¢ The organisation participated health service programmes in the month of March 2005 to the childrdn of weaker section of the society at Lal Singh School of Kharghuli, Guwahati . â€¢ Six Research Projects were submitted by the center to the India Council of Social Science Research, New Delhi which were sanctioned by ICSSR. â€¢ Axom Sarba Siksha Abhijan Mission has approved a reserch study to the organisation on â€œ evaluation of functioning of HTR centers in urban areas with focus on the coverage of working childrenâ€ in the year 2007. The project was done by a team of the center under the guidance of Dr. Kanta Chakravarty. The report was submitted to the sponsored organisation ICSSR in 2012. â€¢ A research project on â€œ A study of the conditions of child labourers of Guwahatiâ€ was completed by a group of research workers under the guidence of Dr Renu Debi in 2011. It was sponsord by Assam State Commission for the protection of child rights. WORKSHOP The Kendra has organized a workshop on â€œProspectus and Development of Tourism North East Indiaâ€ in the month of February at Srimanta Sankardev Kalakhetra, Panjabari, Guwahati, which was sponsored by Indian Council of Social Science Research, New Delhi. SPECIAL SCHOOL FOR CHILD LABOUR The organization has opened four special schools (Gyan Setu Kendra) for Child Labour at Dhirenpara, Ganeshpara, Katahbari and Datalpara of Guwahati under Kamrup Metro District Child Labour Project of National Child Labour scheme. AWARENESS PROGRAMME A Socio-legal awareness programme was organized on 26 th December 2008 at Ganeshpara playground of Guwahati for the spread of education among child workers. The meeting was attended by parents/guardians, employers of child labour and teachers and well known citizens of that locality. A street play â€œ Parhim Parhim Aami Kitap Parhimâ€ based on educating child labour was also presented by the children of the locality. INTERNATIONAL WOMEN DAY The organization has been organizing International Womens Day every year on 8th March.

title: Mime Academy
detailsOfAchievement: Mime Academy established in 1991 is an organisation for the development of Mime headed by Sangeet Natak Awardee, (2009) Moinul Haque, who is a known figure in the field of Art- Culture, Dramatic world of our Country. As an inborn artist Mr.Haque is the pioneer of Mime in India. Moinul Haque has been working in the field of Mime over the last 30 years in diverse characters. His career started in the early 1970 as a Mono Actor. He has acted in plays, films and Tele serials and his versatility made these passages easy and rewarding. Moinul Haque is an empanelled Mime artiste of Indian Council for Cultural Relations, New Delhi, India. For his dedicated work with Deaf and Dumb School at Guwahati, he obtained senior fellowship from the Ministry of Culture, Govt of India. He is a visiting faculty of Allahabad University, Bharatendu Natya Academy, Lucknow, National School of Drama (NSD), New Delhi, Madhya Pradesh School of Drama, Bhopal School of Drama, Guwahati Akhora Ghar, Dibrugarh etc. Mr. Haque has conducted National Workshop of Mime at Rourkella, Orissa, Panchmari, M.P., Gangtok, Sikkim, Andaman & Nicobar Island, Tura, Shillong, Itanagar, Allahabad, Guwahati and many more. Under the able guidance and supervision of Sri Moinul Haque, Gauhati University Mime team has earned many prizes in the National Youth festivals organized under the aegis of Association of Indian Universities, New Delhi. Apart from stage Mime, he has been working for the health awareness Programme of HIV/AIDS, TOBACCO with a Guwahati based Health organization, GNRC at many places in Assam with his repertory Mime Academy.
